text.0: i sing thy fame that maghavan through thy greatness the heavens and earth invoked thee in their terror.
text.1: thou aiding gods didst quell the power of dāsas what time thou holpest many a race o indra.
text.2: when thou wast roaming waxen strong in body telling thy might indra among the people.
text.3: all that men called thy battles was illusion no foe hast thou today nor erst hast found one.
text.4: who are the Ṛṣis then who comprehended before our time the bounds of all thy greatness.
text.5: for from thy body thou hast generated at the same time the mother and the father.
text.6: thou mighty steer hast four supremest natures asura natures that may neer be injured.
text.7: all these o maghavan thou surely knowest wherewith thou hast performed thy great achievements.
text.8: thou hast all treasures in thy sole possession treasures made manifest and treasures hidden.
text.9: defer not thou o maghavan my longing thou art director indra thou art giver.
text.10: to him who set the light in things of splendour and with all sweetness blent essential sweetness.
text.11: to indra hath this welcome hymn that strengthens been uttered by the votary bṛhaduktha.
